title.narrative: COVID-19 MOZAIK Collective Impact for Youth-Lonac.ba
COVID-19 MOZAIK Collective Impact for Youth-Lonac.ba

description.narrative:
New/additional funds to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 Mozaik Foundation has applied to Sida for funding of 6 million SEK to carry out the "Lonac -Collective impact for youth" programme in BiH, during the period 2018-2020.
The overall objective of the Mozaik Lonac project is developing opportunities for self employment in unemployed youth. The project coverage is nationwide and implemented through an online learning platform (lonac.ba) and two physical incubators (one in Sarajevo and one in Banja Luka) Main activities comprise of organizing internships through corporate volunteering and mentoring, and microbusiness start up grants covering up to 90 youth led enterprises over 3 years.
The overall funding of the Mozaik's 2018-2022 LONAC Youth programme is ca. 15 million BAM of which Sida funding is approx. 9%. The funding sought from SDC is 6 million BAM, or about 40% of the total and the rest is forseen to be sourced from other donors.
Sweden will support both the incubators and maintaining the lonac.ba online learning platform which will also be used for local community grant making. These activities are designed theoretically to become self-sustainable by the end of the project, but this is not a main goal of the project-youth employment creation through entrepreneurship is the focus.
Sweden's priorities, including gender equality, poor people's perspectives, conflict sensitivity and environment have been given consideration and are part of the project technical approach. Mozaik has responded to Sida requirements under the environmental impact assessment in simplified format. A simplified gender analysis is also attached to the project application. Mozaik has submited a detailed activity based budget for the Sida part and also for the Swiss part, additionally explained in narrative as requested by the Embassy. Mozaik has submitted project audits for the past 5 years submitted by KPMG. Audits are without recommendations or major findings. Pre award assessment was made of Mozaik by Sida in December 2015 and by SDC internal review more recently. Mozaik has complied with all recommendations with those assessments. Due to external factors Sida was unable to proceed with appraisal in 2016 and postponed its appraisal until end 2017. For 2017 an organization audit of Mozaik has been initiated but will not be ready until June 2018.

Nya medel/medeltillägg för att lindra konsekvenserna av covid-19 Mozaik Foundation har ansökt till Sida för finansiering av 6 miljoner SEK för att genoföra programmet "Lonac -Collective impact for youth" i BiH, under perioden 1018-2020.
Det övergripande målet för Mozaik Lonac projektet är att utveckla möjligheter för egenföretagande bland unga arbetslösa. Projektet är rikstäckande och implementeras genom en internetbaserad läro-plattform(Lonac.ba) och två fysiska inkubatorer(en i Sarajevo och en i Banja Luka). Huvudsakliga aktiviteter består av att organisera praktikplatser genom företagsfrivilligarbete och mentorskap, och uppstartnings mikroföretags stipendier som täcker upp till 90 företag ledda av unga över en period på 3 år.
Den totala förslagna finansieringen av Mozaiks 2018-2020 LONAC Youth program uppgår till ca. 15 miljoner BAM, av dessa är Sidas finansiering uppskattningsvis 9 %. Finansieringen som sökts från SDC är 6 miljoner BAM, eller runt 40 % av den totala finansieringen, resterande förväntas hämtas från andra donatorer.
Sverige kommer stötta både inkubatorerna och underhållet av den internetbaserad läro-plattformen lonac.ba som också kommer användas för lokalt stipendieskapande. Dessa aktiviteter är teoretiskt designade för att bli självförsörjande tills slutet av projektet, men det är inte ett huvudmål för projektet-skapandet av anställningar för unga genom entreprenörskap är fokus.
Sveriges prioriteringar, jämnställdhet, fattigdomsperspektivet, konflikt sensebillitet och miljö inkluderat har getts hänsyn och är en del av projektets tekniska approach. Mozaik har responderat till Sidas krav på analys om miljöpåverkan i ett förenklat format. En förenklad genus analys har också bifogats i projektets ansökan. Mozaik har överlämnat en detaljerad aktivitets baserad budget för Sidas del och även för Schweiz del, vidare förklarat i narrativ som efterfrågats av ambassaden. Mozaik har lämnat in projektrevisioner från de senaste 5 åren inlämnat av KPM. Revisionerna har inga rekommendationer eller huvudsakliga undersökningsresultat. En pre-award bedömning gjordes om Mozaik av Sida i december 2015 och mer nyligen av SDCs inter utverdering. Mozaik har uppfyllt alla rekommendationer från de utvärderingarna. Tillföljd av externa faktorer kunde inte Sida fortsätta med bedömningen 2016 och sköt upp utvärderingen till slutet av 2017. För 2017 har en organisations revision av Mosaik inletts men kommer inte vara färdig förens juni 2018.

The objective is to create a nation-wide, multi stakeholder and value driven ecosystem (LONAC) that provides ongoing and tailor made opportunities for any young woman and man, regardless of her or his identities or location to succeed in social and or economic sector of BiH.

tag.narrative: 8.3 - Främja utvecklingsinriktad politik som stöder produktiv verksamhet, skapande av anständiga arbetstillfällen, företagande, kreativitet och innovation samt uppmuntra att mikroföretag liksom små och medelstora företag växer och blir en del av den formella ekonomin, bland annat genom tillgång till finansiella tjänster.

8.3 - Promote development-oriented policies that support productive activities, decent job creation, entrepreneurship, creativity and innovation, and encourage the formalization and growth of micro-, small- and medium-sized enterprises, including through access to financial services.

description.narrative: The annual and final financial and narrative reporting has been delivered on time and in accordance to the agreement. The narrative report provides a short overview of achieved results, indicating that the online platform for enteprenuership and activism, lonac.pro, as the first objective of the Sweden support project grew to more than 50 thousand members. The facebook profile for lonac has over 8 thousand followers. An internship channel with MOZAIK for young people to work on lonac software improvements have been successful and valued by young people. The corporate volunteering sessions on the lonac platform continue to grow and register new partners (MONRI, OLX, DM) as well as expand into the region(Serbian Chamber of Commerce, Trag Foundation) The second objective, promotion of microbusiness, is also reported as having been successfully managed. A total of 142 microbusiness were registered through the Swedish support. This is substantially more than the 90 planned indicator. Even more would have been reached (Mozaik signed over 200 contracts with entepreneurs but many were cancelled due to COVID impact) The final, third objective, was to establish two local centers (named Startup studios) for enteprenuers. Three have been established, first in Banja Luka, then Sarajevo and Bihac. The local centers are designed with sustainability considerations (business plans) The center is among other services providing a co working space with equipment for a fee. Apart from the municipalities Mozaik partnered with the Banja Luka Innovation Center and in Sarajevo with the Foreign Relationship Council. COVID impacted the plans for organizing events in the studios but the studios remained otherwise used in planned capacities. The studios offer a full program of services for enteprenuers (including mentoring, raising capital, accounting services at low cost, and alternative financing instruments such as special bank products (social banking) In 2019, the Embassy decided to channel new funds for DEMO/HR to Mozaik Fondation. The additional amount was for 1.4MSEK. 54 small grants were awarded for youth led projects through an open call. The support provided by Sweden was integrated into overall Mozaik's "Youthbank" program which in the period from June 2019 to July 2021 awarded 1 360 youth led projects with a total value of more than 1MEUR. The Youthbank programme is reported to have raised 26% of funding from the partner municipality's own contributions. The focus of these grants was on trainings for social activism (teamwork in multiethnic environment), project design and some were made for youth strategy implementation combining with municipal funding. COVID did not disrupt plans for trainings as they were held online. Planned annual conferences over internet platforms were held despite COVID. They were well attended. COVID response: Mozaik implemented several COVID responses/adjustments including pro bono mentoring support, a social banking pilot with Sparkasse bank/ESFE and a specialized bookkeeping service for small social businesses. Sweden funded a small pilot activity as part of the COVID respones: opening of an intergenerational solidarity channel on the lonac platform. It is designed to promote connectivity for older people and at the same time build life skills of younger people. 80 people were selected for this pilot and several success stories promoted on social media. A public call was launched through the Youthbank program and ended up funding 7 intergenerational community projects. Details and links to all sub granted projects and links to success stories are part of the report annex. Based on the project reports and data collected and processed by Mozaik Foundation, it can be concluded that most of the outcome and output indicators defined by the project plan have been met. More specifically, 31 out of a total of 35 indicators were achieved in relation to the initial project plan, while 4 indicators were not fully achieved. Some indicators such as Number of new topics created by youth are achieved only 20%, Number of responses provided by corporate volunteers is achieved 45% of the planned and Number of member surveys for software improvement is achieved 68%.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
